reviews.review_msg: It is rare you come across a professor as passionate and helpful as Sasha. He clarifies concepts that are otherwise confusing. He is also a transparent marker. As a course, BUS 483 is applicable to real life. The breakdown is on the heavier side (40% presentation; 60% final), however, Sasha is very accessible for help. 10/10 recommend!
Great prof! I learned so many valuable concepts in this class. She is a fair marker and the exams aren't too difficult.

Melissa has nice lecture slides that show you everything needed outside of 2-3 cases every week. However, her assignments are extremely vague (no rubric provided, info scattered in a random slide during class, sample in syllabus, no info on actual assignment). She also was not very open to feedback when this was raised.

It was Melissa's first class at SFU and man did we get cursed. Week 1- major IT issues, week 2- the building set on fire and we had to be evacuated, end of semester- COVID sent us all home. She was my only prof to still hold lectures online, and adjust grade distributions, and final exam format. She is a gem.

Phenomenal! I took him in buss393 business law and bus 303 business eithics and then bus483. Consistently excellent prof. Called him at his law office for help and he spent 15 mnts on the phone explaining stuff to me. Super knowledgeable about what he teaches. Would give him 2 thumbs up. If you have a choice go with him and hell not dissapoint you

Best teacher at the Business school in my 4.5 years. I am going to do MBA and I wish we had teachers like him there. He knows his stuff so well and his classes are amazing. I took him for commercial law class, businEST ethics and now Employment Law. He is so interesting and passionate about the stuff he teaches. Big waitlists for his classes.
